Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that President Kagame suggested South Africa be expelled from the African Union.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Kagame did not make any statements suggesting the expulsion of South Africa from the African Union.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by falsely attributing statements to President Kagame that he did not make.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Kagame made the suggestion to expel South Africa from the African Union, without any basis or evidence.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting false information and misrepresenting the events and statements made by President Kagame.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias in this claim.
